metadata.note: Fields marked as FUTURE_USE are reserved and not currently useful for syslog analysis

traffic.description: Records information about network sessions including start/end times, source/destination, applications, users, and bandwidth usage

fields.name: FUTURE_USE
fields.description: Reserved field for future use

fields.name: Receive Time
fields.description: Time the log was received at the management plane

fields.name: Serial Number
fields.description: Serial number of the firewall that generated the log

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Specifies the type of log; value is TRAFFIC

fields.name: Threat/Content Type
fields.description: Subtype of traffic log; values are start, end, drop, and deny

fields.name: FUTURE_USE
fields.description: Reserved field for future use

fields.name: Generated Time
fields.description: Time the log was generated on the dataplane

fields.name: Source Address
fields.description: Original session source IP address

fields.name: Destination Address
fields.description: Original session destination IP address

fields.name: NAT Source IP
fields.description: If Source NAT performed, the post-NAT Source IP address

fields.name: NAT Destination IP
fields.description: If Destination NAT performed, the post-NAT Destination IP address

fields.name: Rule Name
fields.description: Name of the rule that the session matched

fields.name: Source User
fields.description: Username of the user who initiated the session

fields.name: Destination User
fields.description: Username of the user to which the session was destined

fields.name: Application
fields.description: Application associated with the session

fields.name: Virtual System
fields.description: Virtual System associated with the session

fields.name: Source Zone
fields.description: Zone the session was sourced from

fields.name: Destination Zone
fields.description: Zone the session was destined to

fields.name: Inbound Interface
fields.description: Interface that the session was sourced from

fields.name: Outbound Interface
fields.description: Interface that the session was destined to

fields.name: Log Action
fields.description: Log Forwarding Profile that was applied to the session

fields.name: FUTURE_USE
fields.description: Reserved field for future use

fields.name: Session ID
fields.description: An internal numerical identifier applied to each session

fields.name: Repeat Count
fields.description: Number of sessions with same Source IP, Destination IP, Application, and Subtype seen within 5 seconds

fields.name: Source Port
fields.description: Source port utilized by the session

fields.name: Destination Port
fields.description: Destination port utilized by the session

fields.name: NAT Source Port
fields.description: Post-NAT source port

fields.name: NAT Destination Port
fields.description: Post-NAT destination port

fields.name: Flags
fields.description: 32-bit field that provides details on session; can be decoded by AND-ing values with logged value

fields.name: Protocol
fields.description: IP protocol associated with the session

fields.name: Action
fields.description: Action taken for the session; values are allow, deny, drop, reset-server, reset-client, reset-both

fields.name: Bytes
fields.description: Number of total bytes (transmit and receive) for the session

fields.name: Bytes Sent
fields.description: Number of bytes in the client-to-server direction of the session

fields.name: Bytes Received
fields.description: Number of bytes in the server-to-client direction of the session

fields.name: Packets
fields.description: Number of total packets (transmit and receive) for the session

fields.name: Start Time
fields.description: Time of session start

fields.name: Elapsed Time
fields.description: Elapsed time of the session

fields.name: Category
fields.description: URL category associated with the session (if applicable)

fields.name: FUTURE_USE
fields.description: Reserved field for future use

fields.name: Sequence Number
fields.description: A 64-bit log entry identifier incremented sequentially; each log type has a unique number space

fields.name: Action Flags
fields.description: A bit field indicating if the log was forwarded to Panorama

fields.name: Source Country
fields.description: Source country or Internal region for private addresses; maximum length is 32 bytes

fields.name: Destination Country
fields.description: Destination country or Internal region for private addresses; maximum length is 32 bytes

fields.name: FUTURE_USE
fields.description: Reserved field for future use

fields.name: Packets Sent
fields.description: Number of client-to-server packets for the session

fields.name: Packets Received
fields.description: Number of server-to-client packets for the session

fields.name: Session End Reason
fields.description: The reason a session terminated; if multiple causes, displays only highest priority reason

fields.name: Device Group Hierarchy Level 1
fields.description: Identification number indicating device group's location within hierarchy (level 1)

fields.name: Device Group Hierarchy Level 2
fields.description: Identification number indicating device group's location within hierarchy (level 2)

fields.name: Device Group Hierarchy Level 3
fields.description: Identification number indicating device group's location within hierarchy (level 3)

fields.name: Device Group Hierarchy Level 4
fields.description: Identification number indicating device group's location within hierarchy (level 4)

fields.name: Virtual System Name
fields.description: The name of the virtual system associated with the session; only valid on firewalls enabled for multiple virtual systems

fields.name: Device Name
fields.description: The hostname of the firewall on which the session was logged

fields.name: Action Source
fields.description: Specifies whether the action to allow or block was defined in the application or in policy

fields.name: Source VM UUID
fields.description: Source universal unique identifier for a guest virtual machine in the VMware NSX environment

fields.name: Destination VM UUID
fields.description: Destination universal unique identifier for a guest virtual machine in the VMware NSX environment

fields.name: Tunnel ID/IMSI
fields.description: International Mobile Subscriber Identity (IMSI); unique number for mobile subscriber (max 15 digits)

fields.name: Monitor Tag/IMEI
fields.description: International Mobile Equipment Identity (IMEI); unique 15 or 16 digit number for mobile equipment

fields.name: Parent Session ID
fields.description: ID of the session in which this session is tunneled

fields.name: Parent Start Time
fields.description: Year/month/day hours:minutes:seconds that the parent tunnel session began

fields.name: Tunnel Type
fields.description: Type of tunnel, such as GRE or IPSec

fields.name: SCTP Association ID
fields.description: Number that identifies all connections for an association between two SCTP endpoints

fields.name: SCTP Chunks
fields.description: Sum of SCTP chunks sent and received for an association

fields.name: SCTP Chunks Sent
fields.description: Number of SCTP chunks sent for an association

fields.name: SCTP Chunks Received
fields.description: Number of SCTP chunks received for an association

fields.name: Rule UUID
fields.description: The UUID that permanently identifies the rule

fields.name: HTTP/2 Connection
fields.description: Identifies if traffic used an HTTP/2 Connection (0=No, 1=Yes or TCP session ID)

fields.name: App Flap Count
fields.description: Number of link flaps that occurred during the session

fields.name: Policy ID
fields.description: Name of the SD-WAN policy

fields.name: Link Switches
fields.description: Contains up to four link flap entries with link details

fields.name: SD-WAN Cluster
fields.description: Name of the SD-WAN cluster

fields.name: SD-WAN Device Type
fields.description: Type of device (hub or branch)

fields.name: SD-WAN Cluster Type
fields.description: Type of cluster (mesh or hub-spoke)

fields.name: SD-WAN Site
fields.description: Name of the SD-WAN site

fields.name: Dynamic User Group Name
fields.description: Name of the dynamic user group that contains the user who initiated the session

fields.name: XFF Address
fields.description: The IP address from X-Forwarded-For header (proxy/load balancer information)

fields.name: Source Device Category
fields.description: The category for the device that Device-ID identifies as the source of the traffic

fields.name: Source Device Profile
fields.description: The device profile for the device that Device-ID identifies as the source of the traffic

fields.name: Source Device Model
fields.description: The model of the device that Device-ID identifies as the source of the traffic

fields.name: Source Device Vendor
fields.description: The vendor of the device that Device-ID identifies as the source of the traffic

fields.name: Source Device OS Family
fields.description: The operating system type for the device that Device-ID identifies as the source

fields.name: Source Device OS Version
fields.description: The version of the operating system for the device that Device-ID identifies as the source

fields.name: Source Hostname
fields.description: The hostname of the device that Device-ID identifies as the source of the traffic

fields.name: Source Mac Address
fields.description: The MAC address for the device that Device-ID identifies as the source of the traffic

fields.name: Destination Device Category
fields.description: The category for the device that Device-ID identifies as the destination

fields.name: Destination Device Profile
fields.description: The device profile for the device that Device-ID identifies as the destination

fields.name: Destination Device Model
fields.description: The model of the device that Device-ID identifies as the destination

fields.name: Destination Device Vendor
fields.description: The vendor of the device that Device-ID identifies as the destination

fields.name: Destination Device OS Family
fields.description: The operating system type for the device that Device-ID identifies as the destination

fields.name: Destination Device OS Version
fields.description: The version of the operating system for the device that Device-ID identifies as the destination

fields.name: Destination Hostname
fields.description: The hostname of the device that Device-ID identifies as the destination

fields.name: Destination Mac Address
fields.description: The MAC address for the device that Device-ID identifies as the destination

fields.name: Container ID
fields.description: The container ID of the PAN-NGFW pod on the Kubernetes node where the application POD is deployed

fields.name: POD Namespace
fields.description: The namespace of the application POD being secured

fields.name: POD Name
fields.description: The application POD being secured

fields.name: Source External Dynamic List
fields.description: The name of the external dynamic list that contains the source IP address of the traffic

fields.name: Destination External Dynamic List
fields.description: The name of the external dynamic list that contains the destination IP address

fields.name: Host ID
fields.description: Unique ID GlobalProtect assigns to identify the host

fields.name: Serial Number
fields.description: Serial number of the user's machine or device

fields.name: Source Dynamic Address Group
fields.description: Original session source dynamic address group

fields.name: Destination Dynamic Address Group
fields.description: Original destination dynamic address group

fields.name: Session Owner
fields.description: The original HA peer session owner in an HA cluster from which session data was synchronized upon failover

fields.name: High Resolution Timestamp
fields.description: Time in milliseconds the log was received at the management plane (format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:ss:sssTZD)

fields.name: A Slice Service Type
fields.description: The A Slice Service Type of the Network Slice ID (5G)

fields.name: A Slice Differentiator
fields.description: The A Slice Differentiator of the Network Slice ID (5G)

fields.name: Application Subcategory
fields.description: The application subcategory specified in the application configuration properties

fields.name: Application Category
fields.description: The application category (business-systems, collaboration, general-internet, media, networking, unknown)

fields.name: Application Technology
fields.description: The application technology (browser-based, client-server, network-protocol, peer-to-peer)

fields.name: Application Risk
fields.description: Risk level associated with the application (1=lowest to 5=highest)

fields.name: Application Characteristic
fields.description: Comma-separated list of applicable characteristics of the application

fields.name: Application Container
fields.description: The parent application for an application

fields.name: Tunneled Application
fields.description: Name of the tunneled application

fields.name: Application SaaS
fields.description: Displays 1 if a SaaS application or 0 if not a SaaS application

fields.name: Application Sanctioned State
fields.description: Displays 1 if application is sanctioned or 0 if not sanctioned

fields.name: Offloaded
fields.description: Displays 1 if traffic flow has been offloaded or 0 if not offloaded

fields.name: Flow Type
fields.description: Identifies the type of proxy used for traffic. If a proxy is used, Explicit Proxy or Transparent Proxy is displayed. If no proxy is used, NonProxyTraffic is displayed

fields.name: Cluster Name
fields.description: NName of the CN-Series firewall cluster

threat.description: Captures security threats detected by threat prevention profiles including malware, exploits, C2 callbacks, and malicious URLs

fields.name: FUTURE_USE
fields.description: Reserved field for future use

fields.name: Receive Time
fields.description: Time the log was received at the management plane

fields.name: Serial Number
fields.description: Serial number of the firewall that generated the log

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Specifies the type of log; value is THREAT

fields.name: Threat/Content Type
fields.description: Subtype of threat log (url, data, file, virus, spyware, vulnerability, wildfire, wildfire-virus)

fields.name: FUTURE_USE
fields.description: Reserved field for future use

fields.name: Generated Time
fields.description: Time the log was generated on the dataplane

fields.name: Source Address
fields.description: Original session source IP address

fields.name: Destination Address
fields.description: Original session destination IP address

fields.name: NAT Source IP
fields.description: If source NAT performed, the post-NAT source IP address

fields.name: NAT Destination IP
fields.description: If destination NAT performed, the post-NAT destination IP address

fields.name: Rule Name
fields.description: Name of the rule that the session matched

fields.name: Source User
fields.description: Username of the user who initiated the session

fields.name: Destination User
fields.description: Username of the user to which the session was destined

fields.name: Application
fields.description: Application associated with the session

fields.name: Virtual System
fields.description: Virtual System associated with the session

fields.name: Source Zone
fields.description: Zone the session was sourced from

fields.name: Destination Zone
fields.description: Zone the session was destined to

fields.name: Inbound Interface
fields.description: Interface that the session was sourced from

fields.name: Outbound Interface
fields.description: Interface that the session was destined to

fields.name: Log Action
fields.description: Log Forwarding Profile that was applied to the session

fields.name: FUTURE_USE
fields.description: Reserved field for future use

fields.name: Session ID
fields.description: An internal numerical identifier applied to each session

fields.name: Repeat Count
fields.description: Number of sessions with same Source IP, Destination IP, Application, and Content/Threat Type seen within 5 seconds

fields.name: Source Port
fields.description: Source port utilized by the session

fields.name: Destination Port
fields.description: Destination port utilized by the session

fields.name: NAT Source Port
fields.description: Post-NAT source port

fields.name: NAT Destination Port
fields.description: Post-NAT destination port

fields.name: Flags
fields.description: 32-bit field that provides details on session

fields.name: IP Protocol
fields.description: IP protocol associated with the session

fields.name: Action
fields.description: Action taken for the session (alert, allow, deny, drop, drop-all-packets, reset-client, reset-server, reset-both, block-url)

fields.name: URL/Filename
fields.description: Variable length field: URL (max 1023 chars) or Filename (max 63 chars); content varies by subtype

fields.name: Threat ID
fields.description: Palo Alto Networks identifier for known and custom threats; description string followed by 64-bit numerical identifier

fields.name: Category
fields.description: For URL: URL Category; For WildFire: verdict (malware/phishing/grayware/benign); For others: 'any'

fields.name: Severity
fields.description: Severity associated with the threat (informational, low, medium, high, critical)

fields.name: Direction
fields.description: Indicates the direction of the attack (client-to-server or server-to-client)

fields.name: Sequence Number
fields.description: A 64-bit log entry identifier incremented sequentially; each log type has unique number space

fields.name: Action Flags
fields.description: A bit field indicating if the log was forwarded to Panorama

fields.name: Source Location
fields.description: Source country or Internal region for private addresses; maximum length is 32 bytes

fields.name: Destination Location
fields.description: Destination country or Internal region for private addresses; maximum length is 32 bytes

fields.name: FUTURE_USE
fields.description: Reserved field for future use

fields.name: Content Type
fields.description: Content type of the HTTP response data; maximum length 32 bytes (URL subtype only)

fields.name: PCAP_ID
fields.description: 64-bit packet capture ID to correlate threat pcap files with extended pcaps

fields.name: File Digest
fields.description: Binary hash of the file sent to WildFire for analysis (WildFire subtype only)

fields.name: Cloud
fields.description: FQDN of WildFire appliance (private) or WildFire cloud (public) (WildFire subtype only)

fields.name: URL Index
fields.description: Counter to correlate the order of each URL log entry within a single session ID

fields.name: User Agent
fields.description: Web browser that the user used to access the URL (URL Filtering subtype only)

fields.name: File Type
fields.description: Type of file that the firewall forwarded for WildFire analysis (WildFire subtype only)

fields.name: X-Forwarded-For
fields.description: IP address from X-Forwarded-For header; useful when proxy replaces user IP (URL Filtering subtype only)

fields.name: Referer
fields.description: URL of the web page that linked the user to another web page (URL Filtering subtype only)

fields.name: Sender
fields.description: Name of the sender of an email

fields.name: Subject
fields.description: Subject of an email

fields.name: Recipient
fields.description: Name of the receiver of an email

fields.name: Report ID
fields.description: Identifies the analysis request on firewall, WildFire cloud, or WildFire appliance (Data Filtering and WildFire only)

fields.name: Device Group Hierarchy Level 1
fields.description: Identification number indicating device group's location within hierarchy (level 1)

fields.name: Device Group Hierarchy Level 2
fields.description: Identification number indicating device group's location within hierarchy (level 2)

fields.name: Device Group Hierarchy Level 3
fields.description: Identification number indicating device group's location within hierarchy (level 3)

fields.name: Device Group Hierarchy Level 4
fields.description: Identification number indicating device group's location within hierarchy (level 4)

fields.name: Virtual System Name
fields.description: The name of the virtual system associated with the session

fields.name: Device Name
fields.description: The hostname of the firewall on which the session was logged

fields.name: FUTURE_USE
fields.description: Reserved field for future use

fields.name: Source VM UUID
fields.description: Source universal unique identifier for a guest virtual machine in VMware NSX environment

fields.name: Destination VM UUID
fields.description: Destination universal unique identifier for a guest virtual machine in VMware NSX environment

fields.name: HTTP Method
fields.description: HTTP Method used in the web request (Connect, Delete, Get, Head, Options, Post, Put) (URL filtering only)

fields.name: Tunnel ID/IMSI
fields.description: International Mobile Subscriber Identity; unique number for mobile subscriber (max 15 digits)

fields.name: Monitor Tag/IMEI
fields.description: International Mobile Equipment Identity; unique 15 or 16 digit number for mobile equipment

fields.name: Parent Session ID
fields.description: ID of the session in which this session is tunneled

fields.name: Parent Start Time
fields.description: Year/month/day hours:minutes:seconds that the parent tunnel session began

fields.name: Tunnel Type
fields.description: Type of tunnel, such as GRE or IPSec

fields.name: Threat Category
fields.description: Describes threat category (any, command-and-control, dns-c2, dns-ddns, etc.)

fields.name: Content Version
fields.description: Applications and Threats version on your firewall when the log was generated

fields.name: FUTURE_USE
fields.description: Reserved field for future use

fields.name: SCTP Association ID
fields.description: Number that identifies all connections for an association between two SCTP endpoints

fields.name: Payload Protocol ID
fields.description: ID of the protocol for the payload in the data portion of the data chunk

fields.name: HTTP Headers
fields.description: Indicates the inserted HTTP header in the URL log entries on the firewall

fields.name: URL Category List
fields.description: Lists the URL categories associated with the session

fields.name: Rule UUID
fields.description: The UUID that permanently identifies the rule

fields.name: HTTP/2 Connection
fields.description: TCP connection session ID if HTTP/2, or 0 if not HTTP/2

fields.name: Dynamic User Group Name
fields.description: Name of the dynamic user group that contains the user who initiated the session

fields.name: XFF Address
fields.description: IP address from X-Forwarded-For (proxy/load balancer information)

fields.name: Source Device Category
fields.description: The category for the device that Device-ID identifies as the source

fields.name: Source Device Profile
fields.description: The device profile for the device that Device-ID identifies as the source

fields.name: Source Device Model
fields.description: The model of the device that Device-ID identifies as the source

fields.name: Source Device Vendor
fields.description: The vendor of the device that Device-ID identifies as the source

fields.name: Source Device OS Family
fields.description: The operating system type for the device that Device-ID identifies as the source

fields.name: Source Device OS Version
fields.description: The version of the operating system for the device that Device-ID identifies as the source

fields.name: Source Hostname
fields.description: The hostname of the device that Device-ID identifies as the source

fields.name: Source MAC Address
fields.description: The MAC address for the device that Device-ID identifies as the source

fields.name: Destination Device Category
fields.description: The category for the device that Device-ID identifies as the destination

fields.name: Destination Device Profile
fields.description: The device profile for the device that Device-ID identifies as the destination

fields.name: Destination Device Model
fields.description: The model of the device that Device-ID identifies as the destination

fields.name: Destination Device Vendor
fields.description: The vendor of the device that Device-ID identifies as the destination

fields.name: Destination Device OS Family
fields.description: The operating system type for the device that Device-ID identifies as the destination

fields.name: Destination Device OS Version
fields.description: The version of the operating system for the device that Device-ID identifies as the destination

fields.name: Destination Hostname
fields.description: The hostname of the device that Device-ID identifies as the destination

fields.name: Destination MAC Address
fields.description: The MAC address for the device that Device-ID identifies as the destination

fields.name: Container ID
fields.description: The container ID of the PAN-NGFW pod on the Kubernetes node

fields.name: POD Namespace
fields.description: The namespace of the application POD being secured

fields.name: POD Name
fields.description: The application POD being secured

fields.name: Source External Dynamic List
fields.description: The name of the external dynamic list that contains the source IP address

fields.name: Destination External Dynamic List
fields.description: The name of the external dynamic list that contains the destination IP address

fields.name: Host ID
fields.description: Unique ID GlobalProtect assigns to identify the host

fields.name: Serial Number
fields.description: Serial number of the user's machine or device

fields.name: Domain EDL
fields.description: The name of the external dynamic list that contains the domain name of the traffic

fields.name: Source Dynamic Address Group
fields.description: Original session source dynamic address group

fields.name: Destination Dynamic Address Group
fields.description: Original destination dynamic address group

fields.name: Partial Hash
fields.description: Machine Learning partial hash

fields.name: High Resolution Timestamp
fields.description: Time in milliseconds the log was received at the management plane (format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:ss:sssTZD)

fields.name: Reason
fields.description: Reason for Data Filtering action

fields.name: Justification
fields.description: Justification for Data Filtering action

fields.name: A Slice Service Type
fields.description: The A Slice Service Type of the Network Slice ID (5G)

fields.name: Application Subcategory
fields.description: The application subcategory specified in the application configuration properties

fields.name: Application Category
fields.description: The application category (business-systems, collaboration, general-internet, media, networking, saas)

fields.name: Application Technology
fields.description: The application technology (browser-based, client-server, network-protocol, peer-to-peer)

fields.name: Application Risk
fields.description: Risk level associated with the application (1=lowest to 5=highest)

fields.name: Application Characteristic
fields.description: Comma-separated list of applicable characteristics of the application

fields.name: Application Container
fields.description: The parent application for an application

fields.name: Tunneled Application
fields.description: Name of the tunneled application

fields.name: Application SaaS
fields.description: Displays 1 if a SaaS application or 0 if not

fields.name: Application Sanctioned State
fields.description: Displays 1 if application is sanctioned or 0 if not

fields.name: Cloud Report ID
fields.description: Unique 32 (PAN-OS 10.2.0) or 67 character (10.2.1+) ID for file scanned by DLP cloud service

globalprotect.description: Records GlobalProtect VPN client connections, authentications, gateway selections, and connection errors

fields.name: FUTURE_USE
fields.description: Reserved field for future use

fields.name: Receive Time
fields.description: The time that the log was received at the management plane

fields.name: Serial Number
fields.description: The serial number of the firewall that generated the log

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Specifies the type of log; value is GLOBALPROTECT

fields.name: Threat/Content Type
fields.description: Subtype of GlobalProtect log (gateway events, authentication events, etc.)

fields.name: FUTURE_USE
fields.description: Reserved field for future use

fields.name: Generated Time
fields.description: The time that the log was generated on the dataplane

fields.name: Virtual System
fields.description: The Virtual System associated with the session

fields.name: Event ID
fields.description: A string showing the name of the event

fields.name: Stage
fields.description: A string showing the stage of the connection (before-login, login, or tunnel)

fields.name: Authentication Method
fields.description: A string showing the authentication type, such as LDAP, RADIUS, or SAML

fields.name: Tunnel Type
fields.description: The type of tunnel (either SSLVPN or IPSec)

fields.name: Source User
fields.description: The username of the user who initiated the session

fields.name: Source Region
fields.description: The region for the user who initiated the session

fields.name: Machine Name
fields.description: The name of the user's machine

fields.name: Public IP
fields.description: The public IP address for the user who initiated the session

fields.name: Public IPv6
fields.description: The public IPv6 address for the user who initiated the session

fields.name: Private IP
fields.description: The private IP address for the user who initiated the session

fields.name: Private IPv6
fields.description: The private IPv6 address for the user who initiated the session

fields.name: Host ID
fields.description: The unique ID that GlobalProtect assigns to identify the host

fields.name: Serial Number
fields.description: The serial number of the user's machine or device

fields.name: Client Version
fields.description: The client's GlobalProtect app version

fields.name: Client OS
fields.description: The client device's OS type (Windows, Linux, macOS, iOS, Android)

fields.name: Client OS Version
fields.description: The client device's OS version

fields.name: Repeat Count
fields.description: The number of sessions with same source IP, destination IP, application, and subtype within last 5 seconds

fields.name: Reason
fields.description: A string that shows the reason for the quarantine

fields.name: Error
fields.description: A string showing the error that has occurred in any event

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Additional information for any event that has occurred

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The status (success or failure) of the event

fields.name: Location
fields.description: A string showing the administrator-defined location of the GlobalProtect portal or gateway

fields.name: Login Duration
fields.description: The length of time, in seconds, the user is connected to GlobalProtect gateway from login to logout

fields.name: Connect Method
fields.description: How the GlobalProtect app connects to Gateway (on-demand or user-logon)

fields.name: Error Code
fields.description: An integer associated with any errors that occurred

fields.name: Portal
fields.description: The name of the GlobalProtect portal or gateway

fields.name: Sequence Number
fields.description: A 64-bit log entry identifier incremented sequentially

fields.name: Action Flags
fields.description: A bit field indicating if the log was forwarded to Panorama

fields.name: High Res Timestamp
fields.description: Time in milliseconds the log was received at the management plane

fields.name: Selection Type
fields.description: The connection method selected to connect to the gateway (priority, manual, or always-on)

fields.name: Response Time
fields.description: The SSL response time of the selected gateway measured in milliseconds during tunnel setup

fields.name: Priority
fields.description: The priority order of the gateway (highest=1, high=2, medium=3, low=4, lowest=5)

fields.name: Attempted Gateways
fields.description: Fields collected for each gateway connection attempt (gateway name, SSL response time, priority)

fields.name: Gateway
fields.description: The name of the gateway specified on the portal configuration

fields.name: Device Group Hierarchy Level 1
fields.description: Identification number indicating device group's location within hierarchy (level 1)

fields.name: Device Group Hierarchy Level 2
fields.description: Identification number indicating device group's location within hierarchy (level 2)

fields.name: Device Group Hierarchy Level 3
fields.description: Identification number indicating device group's location within hierarchy (level 3)

fields.name: Device Group Hierarchy Level 4
fields.description: Identification number indicating device group's location within hierarchy (level 4)

fields.name: Virtual System Name
fields.description: The name of the virtual system associated with the session

fields.name: Device Name
fields.description: The hostname of the firewall on which the session was logged

fields.name: Virtual System ID
fields.description: A unique identifier for a virtual system on a Palo Alto Networks firewall

fields.name: Cluster Name
fields.description: Name of the CN-Series firewall cluster (11.1 and later releases)

decryption.description: Records TLS/SSL decryption sessions, certificate details, and decryption errors for troubleshooting and monitoring encrypted traffic inspection

fields.name: FUTURE_USE
fields.description: Reserved field for future use

fields.name: Receive Time
fields.description: Time the log was received at the management plane

fields.name: Serial Number
fields.description: Serial number of the firewall that generated the log

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Specifies the type of log; value is DECRYPTION

fields.name: Threat/Content Type
fields.description: Not used in the Decryption log

fields.name: Config Version
fields.description: The software version

fields.name: Generate Time
fields.description: Time the log was generated on the dataplane

fields.name: Source Address
fields.description: Original session source IP address

fields.name: Destination Address
fields.description: Original session destination IP address

fields.name: NAT Source IP
fields.description: If Source NAT performed, the post-NAT Source IP address

fields.name: NAT Destination IP
fields.description: If Destination NAT performed, the post-NAT Destination IP address

fields.name: Rule
fields.description: Security policy rule that controls the session traffic

fields.name: Source User
fields.description: Username of the user who initiated the session

fields.name: Destination User
fields.description: Username of the user to which the session was destined

fields.name: Application
fields.description: Application associated with the session

fields.name: Virtual System
fields.description: Virtual System associated with the session

fields.name: Source Zone
fields.description: Zone the session was sourced from

fields.name: Destination Zone
fields.description: Zone the session was destined to

fields.name: Inbound Interface
fields.description: Interface that the session was sourced from

fields.name: Outbound Interface
fields.description: Interface that the session was destined to

fields.name: Log Action
fields.description: Log Forwarding profile applied to the session

fields.name: Time Logged
fields.description: The time the log was received

fields.name: Session ID
fields.description: An internal numerical identifier applied to each session

fields.name: Repeat Count
fields.description: Number of sessions with same Source IP, Destination IP, Application, and Content/Threat Type within 5 seconds

fields.name: Source Port
fields.description: Source port utilized by the session

fields.name: Destination Port
fields.description: Destination port utilized by the session

fields.name: NAT Source Port
fields.description: Post-NAT source port

fields.name: NAT Destination Port
fields.description: Post-NAT destination port

fields.name: Flags
fields.description: 32-bit field that provides details on session

fields.name: IP Protocol
fields.description: IP protocol associated with the session

fields.name: Action
fields.description: Action taken for the session (allow, deny, drop, reset-server, reset-client, reset-both)

fields.name: Tunnel
fields.description: Type of tunnel

fields.name: FUTURE_USE
fields.description: Reserved field for future use

fields.name: FUTURE_USE
fields.description: Reserved field for future use

fields.name: Source VM UUID
fields.description: The source universal unique identifier for a guest virtual machine in VMware NSX environment

fields.name: Destination VM UUID
fields.description: The destination universal unique identifier for a guest virtual machine in VMware NSX environment

fields.name: UUID for rule
fields.description: The UUID that permanently identifies the rule

fields.name: Stage for Client to Firewall
fields.description: The stage of the TLS handshake from client to firewall (Client Hello, Server Hello, Certificate, etc.)

fields.name: Stage for Firewall to Server
fields.description: The stage of the TLS handshake from firewall to server

fields.name: TLS Version
fields.description: The version of TLS protocol used for the session

fields.name: Key Exchange Algorithm
fields.description: The key exchange algorithm used for the session

fields.name: Encryption Algorithm
fields.description: The algorithm used to encrypt the session data (AES-128-CBC, AES-256-GCM, etc.)

fields.name: Hash Algorithm
fields.description: The authentication algorithm used for the session (SHA, SHA256, SHA384, etc.)

fields.name: Policy Name
fields.description: The name of the Decryption policy associated with the session

fields.name: Elliptic Curve
fields.description: The elliptic cryptography curve used for connections with ECDHE cipher suites

fields.name: Error Index
fields.description: The type of error that occurred (Cipher, Resource, Resume, Version, Protocol, Certificate, Feature, HSM)

fields.name: Root Status
fields.description: The status of the root certificate (trusted, untrusted, or uninspected)

fields.name: Chain Status
fields.description: Whether the certificate chain is trusted (Trusted, Untrusted, or Uninspected)

fields.name: Proxy Type
fields.description: The Decryption proxy type (Forward, Inbound, No Decrypt, GlobalProtect, etc.)

fields.name: Certificate Serial Number
fields.description: The unique identifier of the certificate (generated by the certificate issuer)

fields.name: Fingerprint
fields.description: A hash of the certificate in x509 binary format

fields.name: Certificate Start Date
fields.description: The time the certificate became valid (invalid before this time)

fields.name: Certificate End Date
fields.description: The time the certificate expires (invalid after this time)

fields.name: Certificate Version
fields.description: The certificate version (V1, V2, or V3)

fields.name: Certificate Size
fields.description: The certificate key size

fields.name: Common Name Length
fields.description: The length of the subject common name

fields.name: Issuer Common Name Length
fields.description: The length of the issuer common name

fields.name: Root Common Name Length
fields.description: The length of the root common name

fields.name: SNI Length
fields.description: The length of the Server Name Indication (hostname)

fields.name: Certificate Flags
fields.description: Certificate flags indicating properties (Self-signed, Expired, Untrusted, etc.)

fields.name: Subject Common Name
fields.description: The domain name (the name of the server that the certificate protects)

fields.name: Issuer Subject Common Name
fields.description: The name of the organization that verified the certificate's contents

fields.name: Root Subject Common Name
fields.description: The name of the root certificate authority

fields.name: Server Name Indication
fields.description: The hostname of the server that the client is trying to contact (enables multiple websites on same IP)

fields.name: Error
fields.description: A string showing the error that has occurred in the event

fields.name: Container ID
fields.description: A unique alphanumeric string that identifies the container if firewall runs in cloud container

fields.name: POD Namespace
fields.description: The name of the Kubernetes pod namespace

fields.name: POD Name
fields.description: The name of the kubernetes pod

fields.name: Source External Dynamic List
fields.description: The name of the external dynamic list that contains the source IP address

fields.name: Destination External Dynamic List
fields.description: The name of the external dynamic list that contains the destination IP address

fields.name: Source Dynamic Address Group
fields.description: The dynamic address group that Device-ID identifies as the source

fields.name: Destination Dynamic Address Group
fields.description: The dynamic address group that Device-ID identifies as the destination

fields.name: High Res Timestamp
fields.description: Time in milliseconds the log was received at the management plane (YYYY-MM-DDThh:ss:sssTZD)

fields.name: Source Device Category
fields.description: The category for the device that Device-ID identifies as the source

fields.name: Source Device Profile
fields.description: The device profile for the device that Device-ID identifies as the source

fields.name: Source Device Model
fields.description: The model of the device that Device-ID identifies as the source

fields.name: Source Device Vendor
fields.description: The vendor of the device that Device-ID identifies as the source

fields.name: Source Device OS Family
fields.description: The operating system type for the device that Device-ID identifies as the source

fields.name: Source Device OS Version
fields.description: The version of the operating system for the device that Device-ID identifies as the source

fields.name: Source Hostname
fields.description: The hostname of the device that Device-ID identifies as the source

fields.name: Source Mac Address
fields.description: The MAC address for the device that Device-ID identifies as the source

fields.name: Destination Device Category
fields.description: The category for the device that Device-ID identifies as the destination

fields.name: Destination Device Profile
fields.description: The device profile for the device that Device-ID identifies as the destination

fields.name: Destination Device Model
fields.description: The model of the device that Device-ID identifies as the destination

fields.name: Destination Device Vendor
fields.description: The vendor of the device that Device-ID identifies as the destination

fields.name: Destination Device OS Family
fields.description: The operating system type for the device that Device-ID identifies as the destination

fields.name: Destination Device OS Version
fields.description: The version of the operating system for the device that Device-ID identifies as the destination

fields.name: Destination Hostname
fields.description: The hostname of the device that Device-ID identifies as the destination

fields.name: Destination Mac Address
fields.description: The MAC address for the device that Device-ID identifies as the destination

fields.name: Sequence Number
fields.description: A 64-bit log entry identifier incremented sequentially

fields.name: Action Flags
fields.description: A bit field indicating if the log was forwarded to Panorama

fields.name: Device Group Hierarchy Level 1
fields.description: Identification number indicating device group's location within hierarchy (level 1)

fields.name: Device Group Hierarchy Level 2
fields.description: Identification number indicating device group's location within hierarchy (level 2)

fields.name: Device Group Hierarchy Level 3
fields.description: Identification number indicating device group's location within hierarchy (level 3)

fields.name: Device Group Hierarchy Level 4
fields.description: Identification number indicating device group's location within hierarchy (level 4)

fields.name: Virtual System Name
fields.description: The name of the virtual system associated with the session

fields.name: Device Name
fields.description: The hostname of the firewall on which the session was logged

fields.name: Virtual System ID
fields.description: A unique identifier for a virtual system on a Palo Alto Networks firewall

fields.name: Application Subcategory
fields.description: The application subcategory specified in the application configuration properties

fields.name: Application Category
fields.description: The application category (business-systems, collaboration, general-internet, media, networking, saas)

fields.name: Application Technology
fields.description: The application technology (browser-based, client-server, network-protocol, peer-to-peer)

fields.name: Application Risk
fields.description: Risk level associated with the application (1=lowest to 5=highest)

fields.name: Application Characteristic
fields.description: Comma-separated list of applicable characteristics of the application

fields.name: Application Container
fields.description: The parent application for an application

fields.name: Application SaaS
fields.description: Displays 1 if a SaaS application or 0 if not

fields.name: Application Sanctioned State
fields.description: Displays 1 if application is sanctioned or 0 if not

fields.name: Cluster Name
fields.description: Name of the CN-Series firewall cluster

fields.name: SCTP Association ID
fields.description: An internal 56-bit numerical identifier applied to each SCTP association

fields.name: Payload Protocol ID
fields.description: Identifies the Payload Protocol ID (PPID) in the data chunk which triggered this event

fields.name: Severity
fields.description: Severity associated with the event (informational, low, medium, high, critical)

fields.name: SCTP Chunk Type
fields.description: Describes the type of information contained in a chunk (control or data)

fields.name: SCTP Event Type
fields.description: Defines the event triggered per SCTP chunk or packet when SCTP protection profile is applied

fields.name: SCTP Verification Tag 1
fields.description: Used by endpoint1 to verify if SCTP packet belongs to current association and validate endpoint2

fields.name: SCTP Verification Tag 2
fields.description: Used by endpoint2 to verify if SCTP packet belongs to current association and validate endpoint1

fields.name: SCTP Cause Code
fields.description: Sent by endpoint to specify reason for an error condition to other endpoint

fields.name: Diameter App ID
fields.description: The diameter application in the data chunk which triggered the event

fields.name: Diameter Command Code
fields.description: The diameter command code in the data chunk which triggered the event

fields.name: Diameter AVP Code
fields.description: The diameter AVP code in the data chunk which triggered the event

fields.name: SCTP Stream ID
fields.description: ID of the stream which carries the data chunk which triggered the event

fields.name: SCTP Association End Reason
fields.description: Reason an association was terminated (highest priority reason if multiple causes)

fields.name: Op Code
fields.description: Identifies the operation code of application layer SS7 protocols like MAP or CAP

fields.name: SCCP Calling Party SSN
fields.description: The SCCP calling party subsystem number in the data chunk which triggered the event

fields.name: SCCP Calling Party Global Title
fields.description: The SCCP calling party global title in the data chunk which triggered the event

fields.name: SCTP Filter
fields.description: Name of the filter that the SCTP chunk matched

fields.name: SCTP Chunks
fields.description: Number of total chunks (transmit and receive) for the association

fields.name: SCTP Chunks Sent
fields.description: Number of endpoint1-to-endpoint2 chunks for the association

fields.name: SCTP Chunks Received
fields.description: Number of endpoint2-to-endpoint1 chunks for the association

fields.name: Packets
fields.description: Number of total packets (transmit and receive) for the session

fields.name: Packets Sent
fields.description: Number of client-to-server packets for the session

fields.name: Packets Received
fields.description: Number of server-to-client packets for the session

fields.name: UUID for rule
fields.description: The UUID that permanently identifies the rule

fields.name: High Resolution Timestamp
fields.description: Time in milliseconds the log was received at the management plane (YYYY-MM-DDThh:ss:sssTZD)

fields.description: Identification number indicating device group's location within hierarchy (level 4)

fields.name: Virtual System Name
fields.description: The name of the virtual system associated with the IP tagging

fields.description: A unique identifier for a virtual system on a Palo Alto Networks firewall

fields.description: Time in milliseconds the log was received at the management plane
